alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Meriwether; Pike; Talbot; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 5:33AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Meriwether, Pike, northeastern Chattahoochee, western Upson and Talbot Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 532 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Alvaton to Upatoi, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Thomaston, Zebulon, Talbotton, Manchester, Woodbury, Warm Springs, Woodland, Molena, Williamson, Meansville, Junction City, Geneva, Gay, Sunset Village, Lincoln Park, Juniper, Atwater, Hilltop, Baughville and Flint Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM EDT for west central Georgia.
